pli-tv-kd3:0.3.eng: The chapter on entering the rainy-season residence

pli-tv-kd3:0.4.eng: 1. The instruction to enter the rainy-season residence

pli-tv-kd3:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-kd3:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-kd3:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ vassāvāso apaññatto hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:1.1.2.eng: At that time the Buddha had not yet laid down the rainy-season residence for the monks.

pli-tv-kd3:1.1.3.pli: Tedha bhikkhū hemantampi gimhampi vassampi cārikaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-kd3:1.1.3.eng: And so the monks were wandering about in the winter, in the summer, and also during the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd3:1.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā hemantampi gimhampi vassampi cārikaṃ carissanti, haritāni tiṇāni sammaddantā, ekindriyaṃ jīvaṃ viheṭhentā, bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādentā.
pli-tv-kd3:1.2.2.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics go wandering in the winter, in the summer, and even during the rainy season? They’re trampling down the green grass, oppressing one-sensed life, and destroying many small creatures.

pli-tv-kd3:1.2.3.pli: Ime hi nāma aññatitthiyā durakkhātadhammā vassāvāsaṃ allīyissanti saṅkasāyissanti.
pli-tv-kd3:1.2.3.eng: Even the monastics of other religions, with their flawed teachings, settle down for the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd3:1.2.4.pli: Ime hi nāma sakuntakā rukkhaggesu kulāvakāni karitvā vassāvāsaṃ allīyissanti saṅkasāyissanti.
pli-tv-kd3:1.2.4.eng: Even birds make a nest in the top of a tree and settle down for the rainy-season.

pli-tv-kd3:1.2.5.pli: Ime pana samaṇā sakyaputtiyā hemantampi gimhampi vassampi cārikaṃ caranti, haritāni tiṇāni sammaddantā, ekindriyaṃ jīvaṃ viheṭhentā, bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādentā”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:1.2.5.eng: But not so the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-kd3:1.3.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:1.3.1.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd3:1.3.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd3:1.3.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd3:1.3.3.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:1.3.4.comm: Vassaṁ upagantuṁ, literally, “to enter the rainy season”, but the idea of staying put in one place is implied. In these cases vassa, “rainy season”, is used synonymously with vassāvāsa, “rainy-season residence” or “rains residence”.

pli-tv-kd3:2.1.2.eng: “When should we enter the rains residence?”

pli-tv-kd3:2.1.4.eng: “You should enter the rainy-season residence during the rainy season.”

pli-tv-kd3:2.2.2.eng: “How many entries to the rains residence are there?”

pli-tv-kd3:2.2.4.eng: “There are two entries to the rainy-season residence:

pli-tv-kd3:2.2.6.pli: Aparajjugatāya āsāḷhiyā purimikā upagantabbā, māsagatāya āsāḷhiyā pacchimikā upagantabbā—
pli-tv-kd3:2.2.6.eng: The first should be entered on the day after the full moon of July and the second one month after the same full moon.”
pli-tv-kd3:2.2.6.comm: Although the match is not perfect, I have here translated Āsāḷha as July.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.0.eng: 2. The prohibition against wandering during the rainy season, etc.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vassaṃ upagantvā antarāvassaṃ cārikaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-kd3:3.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six entered the rains residence and then went wandering during the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā hemantampi gimhampi vassampi cārikaṃ carissanti, haritāni tiṇāni sammaddantā, ekindriyaṃ jīvaṃ viheṭhentā, bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādentā.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.4.pli: Ime hi nāma aññatitthiyā durakkhātadhammā vassāvāsaṃ allīyissanti saṅkasāyissanti.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.5.pli: Ime hi nāma sakuntakā rukkhaggesu kulāvakāni karitvā vassāvāsaṃ allīyissanti saṅkasāyissanti.

pli-tv-kd3:3.1.6.pli: Ime pana samaṇā sakyaputtiyā hemantampi gimhampi vassampi cārikaṃ caranti, haritāni tiṇāni sammaddantā, ekindriyaṃ jīvaṃ viheṭhentā, bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādentā”ti.

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:3.2.1.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd3:3.2.2.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vassaṃ upagantvā antarāvassaṃ cārikaṃ carissantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd3:3.2.3.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six enter the rains residence and then go wandering during the rainy season?”

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.5.pli: atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd3:3.2.5.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.6.pli: “na, bhikkhave, vassaṃ upagantvā purimaṃ vā temāsaṃ pacchimaṃ vā temāsaṃ avasitvā cārikā pakkamitabbā.
pli-tv-kd3:3.2.6.eng: “After entering the rainy-season residence, you should stay put for the first or the second three-month period before you go wandering.

pli-tv-kd3:3.2.7.eng: If you go wandering during the rainy-season residence period, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū na icchanti vassaṃ upagantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:4.1.1.eng: The monks from the group of six did not want to enter the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:4.1.4.eng: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tadahu vassūpanāyikāya vassaṃ anupagantukāmā sañcicca āvāsaṃ atikkamanti.
pli-tv-kd3:4.2.1.eng: On the day of the entry to the rains residence, the monks from the group of six deliberately bypassed a monastery because they did not want to enter the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:4.2.3.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, tadahu vassūpanāyikāya vassaṃ anupagantukāmena sañcicca āvāso atikkamitabbo.
pli-tv-kd3:4.2.3.eng: “On the day of the entry to the rainy-season residence, you shouldn’t deliberately bypass a monastery because you don’t want to enter the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-kd3:4.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:4.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro vassaṃ ukkaḍḍhitukāmo bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-kd3:4.3.1.eng: At one time King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha wanted to postpone the rains residence. He sent a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:4.3.2.eng: “Would the venerables please enter the rains residence during the next waxing phase of the moon?”

pli-tv-kd3:4.3.4.eng: “You should comply with the wishes of kings.”
pli-tv-kd3:4.3.4.comm: Rājūnaṁ anuvattituṁ, literally, “(You should) behave according to the kings.” This is often understood to mean that monastics are obliged to follow the laws of the land in which they live.

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd3:5.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd3:5.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade udenena upāsakena saṅghaṃ uddissa vihāro kārāpito hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.1.4.eng: At that time the lay follower Udena had had a dwelling built for the Sangha in the Kosalan country.

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.5.eng: He sent a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:5.1.6.pli: “āgacchantu bhadantā, icchāmi dānañca dātuṃ, dhammañca sotuṃ, bhikkhū ca passitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.1.6.eng: “Please come, venerables, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks.”

pli-tv-kd3:5.2.2.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd3:5.2.3.pli: ‘na vassaṃ upagantvā purimaṃ vā temāsaṃ pacchimaṃ vā temāsaṃ avasitvā cārikā pakkamitabbā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.2.3.eng: that a monk who’s entered the rains residence shouldn’t go wandering until after the rains.

pli-tv-kd3:5.2.4.pli: Āgametu udeno upāsako, yāva bhikkhū vassaṃ vasanti.

pli-tv-kd3:5.2.5.eng: Once we’ve completed the rains residence, we’ll come.

pli-tv-kd3:5.2.6.pli: Sace panassa accāyikaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, tattheva āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike vihāraṃ patiṭṭhāpetū”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.2.6.eng: But if the matter is urgent, then give the dwelling in the presence of the local monks.”
pli-tv-kd3:5.2.6.comm: The Pali word translated here as “give” is patiṭṭhāpetu, which normally means “establish”. In the present context I understand it as “establishing a gift”, in the sense that the gift is meant for the Sangha but given in the presence of the local monks. The expression dakkhiṇaṁ patiṭṭhāpeti, “to establish a gift”, is quite common in the Suttas, see SN 3.19:3.2, AN 4.61:16.1, AN 5.41:5.1, AN 5.227:2.3, and AN 6.37:1.2.

pli-tv-kd3:5.3.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā mayā pahite na āgacchissanti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.3.2.eng: “How can the venerables not come when I’ve sent them a message?

pli-tv-kd3:5.3.3.eng: I’m a donor and I provide services. I’m a supporter of the Sangha!”

pli-tv-kd3:5.3.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū udenassa upāsakassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.

pli-tv-kd3:5.3.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd3:5.4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd3:5.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:5.4.2.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sattannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena pahite gantuṃ, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:5.4.2.eng: “If any of seven kinds of persons—

pli-tv-kd3:5.4.3.pli: Bhikkhussa, bhikkhuniyā, sikkhamānāya, sāmaṇerassa, sāmaṇeriyā, upāsakassa, upāsikāya—
pli-tv-kd3:5.4.3.eng: a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower—

pli-tv-kd3:5.4.4.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imesaṃ sattannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena pahite gantuṃ, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:5.4.4.eng: asks you to come, I allow you to go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:5.4.5.eng: And you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:5.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, upāsakena saṅghaṃ uddissa vihāro kārāpito hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:5.5.1.eng: “It may happen, monks, that a male lay follower has had a dwelling built for the Sangha

pli-tv-kd3:5.5.2.pli: So ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:5.5.2.eng: and sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:5.5.3.pli: ‘āgacchantu bhadantā, icchāmi dānañca dātuṃ, dhammañca sotuṃ, bhikkhū ca passitun’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, pahite, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:5.5.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerables, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:5.5.4.eng: And you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:5.6.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, upāsakena saṅghaṃ uddissa aḍḍhayogo kārāpito hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd3:5.6.1.eng: It may happen that a male lay follower has had a stilt house built for the Sangha,
pli-tv-kd3:5.6.1.comm: As elsewhere, I have rendered aḍḍhayoga, pāsāda, and hammiya together as “stilt house”. According to the commentaries, the aḍḍhayoga, the pāsāda, and the hammiya, are all different kinds of pāsāda, “stilt houses”. Rather than try to differentiate between these buildings, which is unlikely to be useful from a practical perspective, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt house”. Here is what the commentaries have to say. Sp 4.294: Aḍḍhayogoti supaṇṇavaṅkagehaṁ, “An aḍḍhayoga is a house bent like a supaṇṇa.” Sp-ṭ 4.294 clarifies: Supaṇṇavaṅkagehanti garuḷapakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, “Supaṇṇavaṅkageha: a house made in the shape of the wings of a garuḷa.” A garuḷa, better known in its Sanskrit form garuḍa, is a mythological bird. Sp 4.294 continues: Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti upariākāsatale patiṭṭhitakūṭāgāro pāsādoyeva, “A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is just a pāsāda that has an upper room on top of its flat roof.” At Sp-ṭ 3.74, however, we find slightly different explanations. It seems clear, however, that all three are stilt houses and that they are distinguished according to their shape and the kind of roof they possess. See also pāsāda, “stilt house”, in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd3:5.6.21.eng: and sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.0.eng: 4. The allowance to go to any of five kinds of persons even if not asked

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:6.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk was sick.

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.2.eng: He sent a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.3.pli: “ahañhi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan”ti.

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.5.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena appahitepi gantuṃ, pageva pahite.
pli-tv-kd3:6.1.5.eng: “Even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, I allow you to go for seven days to any of five kinds of persons—

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.6.eng: a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun.

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.7.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena appahitepi gantuṃ, pageva pahite.

pli-tv-kd3:6.1.8.eng: But you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:6.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:6.2.1.eng: “It may be that a sick monk

pli-tv-kd3:6.2.2.pli: So ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:6.2.2.eng: sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.2.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, appahitepi, pageva pahite—
pli-tv-kd3:6.2.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerables, I’m sick.’ Then, even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, you should go for seven days, thinking,

pli-tv-kd3:6.2.4.pli: ‘gilānabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānabhesajjaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, pucchissāmi vā, upaṭṭhahissāmi vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:6.2.4.eng: ‘I’ll look for food for the sick,’ ‘I’ll look for food for the nurses,’ ‘I’ll look for medicine,’ ‘I’ll enquire about his sickness,’ or ‘I’ll nurse him.’
pli-tv-kd3:6.2.4.comm: Although the Pali expresses these alternatives as if they were a single thought, I take them to be individual reasons for taking the seven-day allowance. This is a common way throughout the Vinaya Piṭaka of expressing such alternatives.

pli-tv-kd3:6.2.5.eng: But you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:6.10.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa saṅgho kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti tajjanīyaṃ vā, niyassaṃ vā, pabbājanīyaṃ vā, paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā, ukkhepanīyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd3:6.10.1.eng: It may be that the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against a monk—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection.
pli-tv-kd3:6.10.1.comm: “Demotion” renders niyassa. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd3:6.10.2.pli: So ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:6.10.2.eng: He sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.10.3.pli: ‘saṅgho me kammaṃ kattukāmo, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, appahitepi, pageva pahite—
pli-tv-kd3:6.10.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerables, the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against me.’ Then, even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, you should go for seven days, thinking,

pli-tv-kd3:6.10.4.pli: ‘kinti nu kho saṅgho kammaṃ na kareyya, lahukāya vā pariṇāmeyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:6.10.4.eng: ‘How may the Sangha not do the procedure?’ or ‘How may the Sangha make it lighter?’

pli-tv-kd3:6.10.5.eng: But you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:6.11.1.pli: Kataṃ vā panassa hoti saṅghena kammaṃ tajjanīyaṃ vā niyassaṃ vā pabbājanīyaṃ vā paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā ukkhepanīyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd3:6.11.1.eng: Or it may be that the Sangha has done a legal procedure against him—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection.

pli-tv-kd3:6.11.2.pli: So ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:6.11.2.eng: He sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.11.3.pli: ‘saṅgho me kammaṃ akāsi, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, appahitepi, pageva pahite—
pli-tv-kd3:6.11.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure against me.’ Then, even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, you should go for seven days, thinking,

pli-tv-kd3:6.11.4.pli: ‘kinti nu kho sammā vatteyya, lomaṃ pāteyya, netthāraṃ vatteyya, saṅgho taṃ kammaṃ paṭippassambheyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:6.11.4.eng: ‘How can I help him behave properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released?’ or ‘What can I do so that the Sangha lifts that procedure?’
pli-tv-kd3:6.11.4.comm: The meaning of the first of these phrases, sammā vattati, is straightforward, but the last two, lomaṁ pāteti and netthāraṁ vattati, are more difficult. Commenting on Bu Ss 13, Sp 1.435 explains: Na lomaṁ pātentīti anulomapaṭipadaṁ appaṭipajjanatāya na pannalomā honti. Na netthāraṁ vattantīti attano nittharaṇamaggaṁ na paṭipajjanti, “Na lomaṁ pātenti: because of their non-practicing in conformity with the path, their bodily hairs are not flat. Na netthāraṁ vattanti: they are not practicing the path for their own getting out (of the offense).” My rendering attempts to capture the meaning in a non-literal way.

pli-tv-kd3:6.11.5.eng: But you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:6.19.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyā saṅgho kammaṃ kattukāmo hoti—
pli-tv-kd3:6.19.1.eng: It may be that the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against a nun—

pli-tv-kd3:6.19.2.pli: tajjanīyaṃ vā, niyassaṃ vā, pabbājanīyaṃ vā, paṭisāraṇīyaṃ vā, ukkhepanīyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-kd3:6.19.2.eng: whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection.

pli-tv-kd3:6.19.3.eng: She sends a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:6.19.5.eng: ‘How may the Sangha not do the procedure?’ or ‘How may the Sangha make it lighter?’

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.0.eng: 5. The allowance to go to any of seven kinds of persons even if not asked

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno mātā gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.1.1.eng: On one occasion the mother of a certain monk was sick.

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.2.eng: She sent a message to her son:

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.3.pli: “ahañhi gilānā, āgacchatu me putto, icchāmi puttassa āgatan”ti.

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.5.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.6.pli: ‘sattannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena pahite gantuṃ, na tveva appahite;
pli-tv-kd3:7.1.6.eng: that one should go for seven days to any of seven kinds of persons, but only when asked,

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.7.pli: pañcannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena appahitepi gantuṃ, pageva pahite’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.1.7.eng: and that one should go for seven days to any of five kinds of persons even if not asked, let alone if one is.

pli-tv-kd3:7.1.8.pli: Ayañca me mātā gilānā, sā ca anupāsikā, kathaṃ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd3:7.1.8.eng: My mother is sick, but she’s not a lay follower. So what should I do?”

pli-tv-kd3:7.2.1.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sattannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena appahitepi gantuṃ, pageva pahite.
pli-tv-kd3:7.2.1.eng: “Even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, I allow you to go for seven days to any of seven kinds of persons—

pli-tv-kd3:7.2.2.pli: Bhikkhussa, bhikkhuniyā, sikkhamānāya, sāmaṇerassa, sāmaṇeriyā, mātuyā ca pitussa ca—
pli-tv-kd3:7.2.2.eng: a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, your mother, your father.

pli-tv-kd3:7.2.3.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imesaṃ sattannaṃ sattāhakaraṇīyena appahitepi gantuṃ, pageva pahite.

pli-tv-kd3:7.2.4.eng: But you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:7.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa mātā gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.3.1.eng: It may be that a monk’s mother is sick

pli-tv-kd3:7.3.2.pli: Sā ce puttassa santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:7.3.2.eng: and sends a message to her son:

pli-tv-kd3:7.3.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilānā, āgacchatu me putto, icchāmi puttassa āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, appahitepi, pageva pahite—
pli-tv-kd3:7.3.3.eng: ‘Please come, I’m sick.’ Then, even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, you should go for seven days, thinking,

pli-tv-kd3:7.3.4.pli: ‘gilānabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānabhesajjaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, pucchissāmi vā, upaṭṭhahissāmi vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.3.4.eng: ‘I’ll look for food for the sick,’ ‘I’ll look for food for the nurses,’ ‘I’ll look for medicine,’ ‘I’ll enquire about her sickness,’ or ‘I’ll nurse her.’

pli-tv-kd3:7.3.5.eng: But you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:7.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa pitā gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.4.1.eng: It may be that a monk’s father is sick

pli-tv-kd3:7.4.2.pli: So ce puttassa santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:7.4.2.eng: and sends a message to his son:

pli-tv-kd3:7.4.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilāno, āgacchatu me putto, icchāmi puttassa āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, appahitepi, pageva pahite—
pli-tv-kd3:7.4.3.eng: ‘Please come, I’m sick.’ Then, even if you’re not asked, let alone if you are, you should go for seven days, thinking,

pli-tv-kd3:7.4.4.pli: ‘gilānabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānupaṭṭhākabhattaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, gilānabhesajjaṃ vā pariyesissāmi, pucchissāmi vā, upaṭṭhahissāmi vā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.4.4.eng: ‘I’ll look for food for the sick,’ ‘I’ll look for food for the nurses,’ ‘I’ll look for medicine,’ ‘I’ll enquire about his sickness,’ or ‘I’ll nurse him.’

pli-tv-kd3:7.4.5.eng: But you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:7.5.0.eng: 6. The allowance to go only when asked

pli-tv-kd3:7.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa bhātā gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.5.1.eng: “It may be that a monk’s brother is sick

pli-tv-kd3:7.5.2.pli: So ce bhātuno santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:7.5.2.eng: and sends a message to his brother:

pli-tv-kd3:7.5.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilāno, āgacchatu me bhātā, icchāmi bhātuno āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, pahite, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:7.5.3.eng: ‘Please come, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:7.5.4.eng: And you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:7.6.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa bhaginī gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.6.1.eng: It may be that a monk’s sister is sick

pli-tv-kd3:7.6.2.pli: Sā ce bhātuno santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—
pli-tv-kd3:7.6.2.eng: and sends a message to her brother:

pli-tv-kd3:7.6.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilānā, āgacchatu me bhātā, icchāmi bhātuno āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, pahite, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:7.6.3.eng: ‘Please come, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:7.6.4.eng: And you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:7.7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa ñātako gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.7.1.eng: It may be that a monk’s relative is sick

pli-tv-kd3:7.7.2.pli: So ce bhikkhussa santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—

pli-tv-kd3:7.7.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilāno, āgacchatu bhadanto, icchāmi bhadantassa āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, pahite, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:7.7.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerable, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:7.7.4.eng: And you should return within seven days.

pli-tv-kd3:7.8.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhugatiko gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:7.8.1.eng: It may be that one who is staying with the monks is sick
pli-tv-kd3:7.8.1.comm: Sp 3.275: Bhikkhugatikoti ekasmiṁ vihāre bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ vasanakapuriso, “Bhikkhugatika means a man living with the monks in a particular monastery.”

pli-tv-kd3:7.8.2.pli: So ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya—

pli-tv-kd3:7.8.3.pli: ‘ahañhi gilāno, āgacchantu bhadantā, icchāmi bhadantānaṃ āgatan’ti, gantabbaṃ, bhikkhave, sattāhakaraṇīyena, pahite, na tveva appahite.
pli-tv-kd3:7.8.3.eng: ‘Please come, venerables, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re asked.

pli-tv-kd3:7.8.4.eng: And you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa vihāro undriyati.
pli-tv-kd3:8.1.1.eng: At one time one of the Sangha’s dwellings was falling apart.

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.2.pli: Aññatarena upāsakena araññe bhaṇḍaṃ chedāpitaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:8.1.2.eng: At that time the timber belonging to a certain lay follower had been cut up in the wilderness.

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.3.eng: He sent a message to the monks:

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.4.pli: “sace bhadantā taṃ bhaṇḍaṃ āvahāpeyyuṃ, dajjāhaṃ taṃ bhaṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:8.1.4.eng: “Venerables, if you retrieve that timber, I’ll give it to you.”

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.6.eng: “I allow you to go on business for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.7.eng: But you should return within seven days.”

pli-tv-kd3:8.1.8.eng: The section for recitation on the rainy-season residence is finished.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.0.eng: 7. The section on no offense for breaking the rains residence when there are dangers

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassūpagatā bhikkhū vāḷehi ubbāḷhā honti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.1.1.eng: At one time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, monks who had entered the rains residence were harassed by predatory animals

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.2.eng: that attacked and grabbed hold of them.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.4.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū vāḷehi ubbāḷhā honti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.1.4.eng: “It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by predatory animals

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.5.eng: that attack and grab hold of them.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.6.eng: When there’s such a danger, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.7.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū sarīsapehi ubbāḷhā honti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.1.8.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by creeping animals

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.10.eng: When there’s such a danger, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.1.11.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū corehi ubbāḷhā honti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.2.1.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by criminals

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.2.eng: who steal from them and beat them up.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.3.eng: When there’s such a danger, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.4.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū pisācehi ubbāḷhā honti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.2.5.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by demons

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.6.eng: who take possession of them and kill them.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.7.eng: When there’s such a danger, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.2.8.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāmo agginā daḍḍho hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.3.1.eng: It may happen that the village where monks have entered the rains residence burns down.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.2.eng: As a consequence, they have trouble getting almsfood.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.3.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.4.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ agginā daḍḍhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.3.5.eng: It may happen that the dwellings where monks have entered the rains residence burn down.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.6.eng: As a consequence, they have trouble getting dwellings.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.7.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.3.8.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāmo udakena vūḷho hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.4.1.eng: It may happen that the village where the monks have entered the rains residence is swept away by flooding.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.2.eng: As a consequence, they have trouble getting almsfood.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.3.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.4.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ senāsanaṃ udakena vūḷhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:9.4.5.eng: It may happen that the dwellings where the monks have entered the rains residence are swept away by flooding.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.6.eng: As a consequence, they have trouble getting dwellings.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.7.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:9.4.8.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.”

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāmo corehi vuṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd3:10.1.1.eng: At one time in a certain monastery, the village where the monks had entered the rains residence relocated because of criminals.

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.3.eng: “I allow you to move to where the village is.”

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.4.eng: The village was divided in two.

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.6.eng: “I allow you to move to where the majority is.”

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.7.eng: The majority had no faith and confidence.

pli-tv-kd3:10.1.9.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yena saddhā pasannā tena gantun”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:10.1.9.eng: “I allow you to move to where those who have faith and confidence are.”

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassūpagatā bhikkhū na labhiṃsu lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṃ pāripūriṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.1.1.eng: At one time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, the monks who had entered the rains residence did not get enough food, whether coarse or fine.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.3.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū na labhanti lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṃ pāripūriṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.1.3.eng: “It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence don’t get enough food, whether coarse or fine.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.4.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.5.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū labhanti lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṃ pāripūriṃ, na labhanti sappāyāni bhojanāni.
pli-tv-kd3:11.1.6.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough food, whether coarse or fine, but the food isn’t suitable for them.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.7.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.1.8.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū labhanti lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṃ pāripūriṃ, labhanti sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labhanti sappāyāni bhesajjāni.
pli-tv-kd3:11.2.1.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough suitable food, whether coarse or fine, but they don’t get suitable medicines.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.2.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.3.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagatā bhikkhū labhanti lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṃ pāripūriṃ, labhanti sappāyāni bhojanāni, labhanti sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labhanti patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.2.4.eng: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough suitable food, whether coarse or fine, as well as suitable medicines, but they don’t get a suitable attendant.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.5.eng: When there’s such an obstacle, you should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.2.6.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagataṃ bhikkhuṃ itthī nimanteti—
pli-tv-kd3:11.3.1.eng: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence is invited by a woman:

pli-tv-kd3:11.3.2.pli: ‘ehi, bhante, hiraññaṃ vā te demi, suvaṇṇaṃ vā te demi, khettaṃ vā te demi, vatthuṃ vā te demi, gāvuṃ vā te demi, gāviṃ vā te demi, dāsaṃ vā te demi, dāsiṃ vā te demi, dhītaraṃ vā te demi bhariyatthāya, ahaṃ vā te bhariyā homi, aññaṃ vā te bhariyaṃ ānemī’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:11.3.2.eng: ‘Come, venerable, I’ll give you money’, ‘I’ll give you gold’, ‘I’ll give you a field’, ‘I’ll give you land’, ‘I’ll give you an ox’, ‘I’ll give you a cow’, ‘I’ll give you a slave’, ‘I’ll give you my daughter as wife’, ‘I’ll be your wife’, ‘I’ll bring you another wife.’
pli-tv-kd3:11.3.2.comm: “Money” renders hirañña, whereas suvaṇṇa is for “gold”. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd3:11.3.4.pli: ‘lahuparivattaṃ kho cittaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, siyāpi me brahmacariyassa antarāyo’ti, pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.3.4.eng: ‘The Buddha has said that the mind is volatile. This could be an obstacle to my monastic life,’ he should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.3.5.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagataṃ bhikkhuṃ vesī nimanteti …pe…
pli-tv-kd3:11.4.1.eng: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence is invited by a sex worker,

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.8.pli: ‘ehi, bhante, hiraññaṃ vā te dema, suvaṇṇaṃ vā te dema, khettaṃ vā te dema, vatthuṃ vā te dema, gāvuṃ vā te dema, gāviṃ vā te dema, dāsaṃ vā te dema, dāsiṃ vā te dema, dhītaraṃ vā te dema bhariyatthāya, aññaṃ vā te bhariyaṃ ānemā’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:11.4.8.eng: ‘Come, venerable, we’ll give you money’, ‘We’ll give you gold’, ‘We’ll give you a field’, ‘We’ll give you land’, ‘We’ll give you an ox’, ‘We’ll give you a cow’, ‘We’ll give you a slave’, ‘We’ll give you our daughter as wife’, ‘We’ll bring you another wife.’

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.10.pli: ‘lahuparivattaṃ kho cittaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, siyāpi me brahmacariyassa antarāyo’ti, pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.4.10.eng: ‘The Buddha has said that the mind is volatile. This could be an obstacle to my monastic life,’ he should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.11.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.12.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagato bhikkhu assāmikaṃ nidhiṃ passati.
pli-tv-kd3:11.4.12.eng: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence sees an ownerless treasure.

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.14.pli: ‘lahuparivattaṃ kho cittaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, siyāpi me brahmacariyassa antarāyo’ti, pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.4.14.eng: ‘The Buddha has said that the mind is volatile. This could be an obstacle to my monastic life,’ he should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.4.15.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.”

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.0.1.eng: 8. The section on no offense for breaking the rains residence when there is schism in the Sangha

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagato bhikkhu passati sambahule bhikkhū saṅghabhedāya parakkamante.
pli-tv-kd3:11.5.1.eng: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence sees a number of monks who are pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.3.eng: ‘The Buddha has said that schism in the Sangha is a serious matter.

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.4.pli: mā mayi sammukhībhūte saṅgho bhijjī’ti, pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd3:11.5.4.eng: I don’t want the Sangha to be divided in my presence,’ he should leave.

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.5.eng: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, vassūpagato bhikkhu suṇāti—
pli-tv-kd3:11.5.6.eng: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.7.pli: ‘asukasmiṃ kira āvāse sambahulā bhikkhū saṅghabhedāya parakkamantī’ti.
pli-tv-kd3:11.5.7.eng: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd3:11.5.9.eng: ‘The Buddha has said that schism in the Sangha is a serious matter.

pli-tv-kd3:12.1.0.eng: 9. Entering the rains residence in a cowherd’s dwelling, etc.

pli-tv-kd3:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu vaje vassaṃ upagantukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:12.1.1.eng: On one occasion a certain monk wanted to enter the rains residence in a cowherd’s dwelling.

pli-tv-kd3:12.1.3.eng: “I allow you to enter the rains residence in a cowherd’s dwelling.”
pli-tv-kd3:12.1.3.comm: “Cowherd’s dwelling” renders vaja. Sp 3.203: Vajoti gopālakānaṁ nivāsaṭṭhānaṁ, “Vajo means the dwelling place of cowherds.” This is apparently a reasonably substantial dwelling with a door, as required by the commentary at Sp 3.204, and not just a sunshade as at Kd 3:12.8.1 below.

pli-tv-kd3:12.1.6.eng: “I allow you to go where the cowherd’s dwelling is.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya satthena gantukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:12.2.1.eng: On one occasion, as the entry to the rains residence was getting close, a certain monk wanted to travel by caravan.

pli-tv-kd3:12.2.3.eng: “I allow you to enter the rains residence in a caravan.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.2.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya nāvāya gantukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-kd3:12.2.4.eng: On one occasion, as the entry to the rains residence was getting close, a certain monk wanted to travel by boat.

pli-tv-kd3:12.2.6.eng: “I allow you to enter the rains residence on a boat.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.3.0.eng: 10. Places where the rains residence should not be entered

pli-tv-kd3:12.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū rukkhasusire vassaṃ upagacchanti.
pli-tv-kd3:12.3.1.eng: At one time monks entered the rains residence in the hollow of a tree.

pli-tv-kd3:12.3.5.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence in the hollow of a tree.

pli-tv-kd3:12.3.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.5.2.eng: When it was raining, they ran for cover under trees and eaves.

pli-tv-kd3:12.5.4.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence out in the open.

pli-tv-kd3:12.5.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.6.1.eng: At one time monks entered the rains residence without a dwelling.

pli-tv-kd3:12.6.2.eng: They suffered in the cold and the heat.

pli-tv-kd3:12.6.4.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence without a dwelling.

pli-tv-kd3:12.6.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.7.5.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence in a charnel house.

pli-tv-kd3:12.7.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.8.5.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence under a sunshade.

pli-tv-kd3:12.8.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū cāṭiyā vassaṃ upagacchanti.
pli-tv-kd3:12.9.1.eng: At one time monks entered the rains residence in a large earthenware pot.
pli-tv-kd3:12.9.1.comm: Sp 3.204: Cāṭiyāti etthāpi mahantena kapallena, “Here cāṭi is a large piece of earthenware.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.9.3.eng: “They’re just like the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-kd3:12.9.5.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the rains residence in a large earthenware pot.

pli-tv-kd3:12.9.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā saṅghena evarūpā katikā katā hoti—
pli-tv-kd3:13.1.1.eng: At one time the Sangha at Sāvatthī had made an agreement

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.2.eng: that they would not give the going forth during the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.3.pli: Visākhāya migāramātuyā nattā bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā pabbajjaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-kd3:13.1.3.eng: Then, one of Visākhā’s grandsons went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.5.pli: “saṅghena kho, āvuso, evarūpā katikā katā ‘antarāvassaṃ na pabbājetabban’ti.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.6.pli: Āgamehi, āvuso, yāva bhikkhū vassaṃ vasanti.
pli-tv-kd3:13.1.6.eng: adding, “Please wait while the monks observe the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.7.eng: Once we’ve completed the rains residence, we’ll give you the going forth.”

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vassaṃvuṭṭhā visākhāya migāramātuyā nattāraṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd3:13.1.8.eng: When they had completed the rains residence, the monks told Visākhā’s grandson

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.9.eng: that they would give him the going forth.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.11.eng: “If I had been given the going forth, venerables, I would have enjoyed it.

pli-tv-kd3:13.1.12.eng: But now I won’t do it.”

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.1.eng: Visākhā complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.2.eng: “How could the venerables make an agreement

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.3.eng: that they wouldn’t give the going forth during the rains residence?

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.4.eng: Is there a time when the Teaching shouldn’t be practiced?”

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū visākhāya migāramātuyā ujjhāyantiyā khiyyantiyā vipācentiyā.

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.8.eng: that you won’t give the going forth during the rains residence.

pli-tv-kd3:13.2.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.0.eng: 12. An offense of wrong conduct for agreeing

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmatā upanandena sakyaputtena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vassāvāso paṭissuto hoti purimikāya.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.1.eng: On one occasion Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had agreed to spend the first rains residence at the invitation of King Pasenadi of Kosala.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.1.comm: This refers to the first of the two entries to the rainy-season residence, as set out above at Kd 3:2.2.4.

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.2.pli: So taṃ āvāsaṃ gacchanto addasa antarāmagge dve āvāse bahucīvarake.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.2.eng: As he was going to the monastery provided by the king, he saw two monasteries with much robe-cloth.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.2.comm: “Robe-cloth” renders cīvara. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.4.eng: “Why don’t I spend the rains residence in these two monasteries?

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.5.eng: That way I’ll get much robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.6.pli: So tesu dvīsu āvāsesu vassaṃ vasi.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.6.eng: And he spent the rains residence in those two monasteries.

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.7.pli: Rājā pasenadi kosalo ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.7.eng: King Pasenadi complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo upanando sakyaputto amhākaṃ vassāvāsaṃ paṭissuṇitvā visaṃvādessati.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.8.eng: “How could Upananda agree to spend the rains residence in my monastery, but then break his word?

pli-tv-kd3:14.1.9.pli: Nanu bhagavatā anekapariyāyena musāvādo garahito, musāvādā veramaṇī pasatthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd3:14.1.9.eng: Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways criticized lying and praised truthfulness?”

pli-tv-kd3:14.2.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū rañño pasenadissa kosalassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-kd3:14.2.1.eng: The monks heard the king’s complaints,

pli-tv-kd3:14.2.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd3:14.2.2.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-kd3:14.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vassāvāsaṃ paṭissuṇitvā visaṃvādessati.

pli-tv-kd3:14.2.4.pli: Nanu bhagavatā anekapariyāyena musāvādo garahito, musāvādā veramaṇī pasatthā”ti.

pli-tv-kd3:14.3.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd3:14.3.2.pli: atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd3:14.3.2.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:

pli-tv-kd3:14.3.3.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vassāvāsaṃ paṭissuṇitvā visaṃvādesī”ti?
pli-tv-kd3:14.3.3.eng: “Is it true that you acted like this?”

pli-tv-kd3:14.3.6.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa vassāvāsaṃ paṭissuṇitvā visaṃvādessasi.
pli-tv-kd3:14.3.6.eng: “Foolish man, how could you agree to spend the rains residence at the invitation of King Pasenadi, but then break your word?
